website_summaries.verdict: The Back-to-Berkeley Redux Leather from The North Face brought a fresh design to winter hiking boots. Regardless of coming in a lightweight package, it was able to satisfy through its versatility and delivery of warmth and comfort.Despite these fulfilling features, it was brought down by durability issues. To conclude, the Back-to-Berkeley Redux Leather proved that it is still it is a good choice for winter hiking. It, however, may not be able to take much beating.
pros: A good number of boot owners declared that it runs true to size
The North Face Back-to-Berkeley Redux Leather’s insulation was effective in keeping the foot warm in cold hikes, according to numerous wearers
An abundance of hikers said that it was very light for a winter boot
It can be worn on almost any occasion—from the trails to city strolls—based on a lot of user reviews
Numerous outdoor lovers were stoked about how the Back-to-Berkeley Redux Leather kept their foot comfortable
cons: Some hikers were disappointed with the durability of the Back-to-Berkeley Redux Leather as its sole separated from the rest of the boot too soon
The waterproofing was a letdown, according to a handful of wearers

customer_reviews.title: Lack of grip
customer_reviews.text: Did they fit correctly? Yes, one star Did they arrive quickly? Yes, another star Were they waterproof? Completely, another star Did they fit ok? They were as comfy as wearing trainers, another star Did they give me good grip? No, absolutely not. On any moderately smooth surface in the wet, these boots gave no grip at all, rediculous when you think they are designed for wet conditions. Walking over wet rocks was like walking on ice and I did lose my footing and hurt my back in the process. Due to this, no fith star
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good boots of poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots, they are very comfortable and look good enough for everyday wear, they are also very well insulated. But they have started to become unglued around the heal already and they haven't been in the wet yet. I have just sent my first pair back for replacement as I'm willing to try another pair before I ask for a refund as I do like them, I just can't believe North Face boots becoming unstuck after such a short time they're not cheap boots. The replacement boots exhibited exactly the same problem, they need gluing after a very short period of wear Boots of poor quality considering the price, will email amazon customer service
customer_reviews.author: P Bloke

customer_reviews.title: These only lasted 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: Don't last! I have had these 4 months. I wear them around once a week for long walks. The sole is already coming away from the shoe and leaking! Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top notch gear
customer_reviews.text: They look good, they are super comfy, they are waterproof and grip wet/slippery ground like nothing else. I do a lot of walking with dogs, I’m through mud, puddles, wet grass, slippery and difficult terrain on a daily basis and these boyos have been perfect. Reasonably priced for North Face stuff and the quality is what you expect trom them, nothing but excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: The most amazing 😉 Boots I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: I think these are the most comfortable boots I have ever purchased. I usually suffer with hard skin and these seem to have diffused that. I use them for everyday work. I have dropped a few things on them and they actually protect your feet better than expected. Very warm for winter, water resistance quite high. Long laces and four hooks make them easy to take off. Recommend a double not to stop them coming undone. All day comfort... Very happy 😊
customer_reviews.author: Martin Day

customer_reviews.title: Total rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Awful boots They are comfi and look ok BUT they are not waterproof or even splash proof , the backs/ heels on these fell off after 9 months and basically rotted away Contacted north face and im still waiting for their “complaints department to call me back” that was 8 months ago! I have a pair of scruffs boots i use for work and they have outlasted these by a year and half and they cost me £45 Awful awful product
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Started as decadent boots, I've had them for about 3 months now, done some biggish walks. Spent allday on the Lakes yesterday, the boots have broken at the seam where the sole is attached to the boot. Clearly not waterproof as I spent allday with wet feet. I thought North Face were meant to be a reputable brand pin the hiking industry. Clearly not. On top of this, worn them 3 times this year one being yesterday. The front of the boot has come unstuck and is starting to come off. The stitching appears to be fraying too. Very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart in a month. Walking through town ,nothing strenuous and testing like you expect a north face product to withstand. Will never buy north face again that's for sure. Had boots a fraction of the price last for years . Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Steve Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof and no grip
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these boots as they weren’t cheap. I paid £100 for them. Bought them in Nov 2019 and by January they were absolutely no longer waterproof. And by waterproof I mean walking in wet fields and in forests, not trekking over streams and the likes. Also, if you are looking for a pair of boots with grip, forget it! I’ve been on my backside more times than I’d like going down hills. Overall, really disappointed. Don’t waste your money. I bought my father a pair of Hi Tec and they are a fabulous boot. They were around £30.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Best quality walking boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots after a recommendation from a regular hiker who has a pair. I have to say that so far my thoughts are that they are fantastic boots and every bit as good as I was told they were. Hardly any wearing in was needed, they were comfortable from the first time I wore them. I have been out in all weathers with them on and they keep my feet warm, dry and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots can be worn out of the box and are very comfortable, I have wide feet and wear work boots a lot of the time, but there are situations where a lighter boot is necessary, these are very light. The workmanship is spot on for the price point, my only quibble is for my feet they are quite tight on the width, but not in a blistering way. I'm sure they'll give after a couple more weeks, I have been in some torrential UK rain in the last week and they have not let any water in.
customer_reviews.author: GEETHA DEVARAJAKONE

customer_reviews.title: Nice retro boots..
customer_reviews.text: Bought as general purpose ‘go to the pub’ in the winter boots, love them! Comfortable, warm and retro styled, great for wandering about in. I’ve never used them on the mountains, so can’t testify to grip etc. I couldn’t see why they wouldn’t work just fine for most walking in town and country..
customer_reviews.author: Robupnorth

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant quality and durability. Beware small sizing. I normally take an 8 in a walking boot with a thick sock but in these I have to wear a sports sock only. Doesn't detract from the boot at all as I get no blisters and there is zero internal wear from rubbing. W oud offer again at the amazing price I paid of £76.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight boots
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of boots. I ended up going for these as there was a lot of positive reviews, and thought I would see for my self. They are very comfortable light weight and have a good sole. I am a 9.5 and that size fitted me spot on. They also look smart under a pair of jeans. Really quick delivery. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Chris in Manchester

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough
customer_reviews.text: It’s durability- although the product has been replaced because it leaked water when raining or walking in long grass - after 2 months it was showing a lot of wear on the heals and inside the lining- I would not buy again as my boots usually last 5/6 months
customer_reviews.author: bob rylands

customer_reviews.title: Best boot-trainer!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice boot. It's exactly what I was after. A boot that was soft and flexible like a trainer, only with the benefits of being the size and shape of a boot. Fully waterproof too & warm. Been in decent snow in France and they've been perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Guy M.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, comfortable straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and warm. Usually take a 9.5 in Adidas trainers these fit exactly the same. I'd probably estimate half a size larger if you're going got thick winter socks. Boots feel and look well made.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Smart black Northface leather boot
customer_reviews.text: Very smart looking black leather boot. Feel comfortable and look the part. £130 seems pricey though and was unimpressed that they jumped up £20 when I went to purchase them. Delivery took a while also.
customer_reviews.author: TripleA

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the most comfortable boots I've ever owned , happy days for the first 6 months. But Unfortunately the sole on the right boot has now split and lets water in. Not long term keepers and very expensive if only last 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: P. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic warm boots, waterproof and extremely comfortable. Just like putting on your favourite pair of trainers. These boots need no breaking in at all. I found my ankles were a little sore where the top of the boots sat but that goes away after a week.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Own 2 pair of these
customer_reviews.text: Got a pair and after 3 weeks got a second pair as was very impressed ! Very comfy and look great with jeans would recommend
customer_reviews.author: John alderson

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy and warm
customer_reviews.text: Aside from them being delivered late, the boots are super comfy and warm and I couldn't be happier with them. They are perfect for this time of year with the wet and cold weather. Might have to get another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for winter. Not used them for hiking et. However very nice and comfortable for long walks and I wear them into town when not meeting clients etc as they're so comfy and there's been a fairly continuous deluge for the last 2 months. I'd say they're a tiny bit snug with thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the brand name fool you.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the worst "hiking" shoes i've ever owned. With casual wear they wore out inside at the back of the heel within weeks. Poor cushion support. Not breathable at all so your feet get sweaty really quickly. Lace support also uncomfortable around the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: The North face boots.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good quality walking boot that was durable&comfortable& Xmas present for my partner he has worn them whilst out walking rambling &is very pleased at how comfortable they are not slippy on wet ground or do they rub as yet .Very satisfied customer! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Just unsure if there real ..the teen says there’s confutable. And Waterproof so they do the job
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: They look too chunky when you wear it. Also the mobility of the foot is limited. They don't have side protection from the cuts or abrasions that rock s could cause.
customer_reviews.author: stefano

customer_reviews.title: Solid pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Good quality boots, really warm and comfortable inside with good ankle support. Soles are solid and look like they'll provide a lot of wear. I got the black version and aside from looking a bit too plain in my opinion are quite smart

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase these boots unless you want wet feet
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, bought these boots for outdoor use. The minute light moisture was encountered the boots began to leak. They soak water up like a sponge. I've tried waterproofing products on them which shouldn't be necessary. Currently purchasing different boots!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beccy Eldred

customer_reviews.title: Good boot, but not for mountains.
customer_reviews.text: Had to order a smaller size than my usual 8, - 6.5 (uk) this time, but a great boot for rainy city walking, wouldn’t take these to the mountains though, sole is too spongey and I could see grip becoming a problem. Top boot nonetheless
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy and light..
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy..light..and warm...im loving them...lets see how long they last in the scottish weather..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Excellent as usual from North Face.. Only small gripe is the tongue is too short to use the top cleats
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof, do not grip very well, slippery even on wet tarmac.
customer_reviews.author: smiles

customer_reviews.title: Terrible construction quality. Not waterproof, soles coming unstuck, fixed insole
customer_reviews.text: Awful quality boots. They are not waterproof as stated, the soles are coming unstuck and are not stitched. The insoles have worn out already and aren’t removable. Utter junk. Purely designed for mincing about town. Please describe these as what they are and not as walking boots!

customer_reviews.title: ok boot but no grip
customer_reviews.text: boot decent enough at the price i paid but the grip in wet conditions is horredous bordering on dangerous so buyer beware would have expected more from North face but built on the cheap in Vietnam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Wearing them as I write. Very good product at a very affordable price. I use these boots for hiking and leisure.

customer_reviews.title: The tank of boots
customer_reviews.text: These are a solid walking boot comfort straight from the get go on the down side they’ve got hook eyes on near the top of the boot they have legged me up a few times now just never have your laces swinging about because they will catch you out😳 They are wet grass proof too

customer_reviews.text: Great boot. Extremely comfortable and looks good. I had to go half a size bigger FYI, they run a bit small. Build is good, I put some Wax on them to help with the waterproofing.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit and very comfortable.

customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots. I normally buy much cheaper boots to walk my dog but decided to bite the bullet and buy these. I am glad I did. The are extremely comfortable, light, warm and waterproof. Real quality.

Not used them in any wet weather yet so can’t comment on how they would handle those conditions. Overall they seem a very good boot, glad I purchased them.

customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and warm, only down fall is that if you out on a frosty morning you are slipping all over the place, Iam a walking engineer so foot waer is a issue and I dont feel safe in these boots.. A massive let down on the soles!!! Beware!!

customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. It doesn't keep you feet warm in the freezing weathers (lower than 0oC). In temperatures above 0oC it works very well. I recommend.

product_meta.title: The North Face Men's Back-to-Berkeley Redux Leather High Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: These Back-to-Berkeley Redux Leather boots from The North Face feature waterproof, full-grain leather upper and hydroseal waterproof membrane. These boots also feature compression-moulded eva midsole, ortholite rebound foot bed along with compression-moulded tpu heel clip. Insulation traps hot air for reduced heat loss and increased warmth. These boots are designed to replicate the qualities of down, but retain them even when wet. Blending an old-school silhouette with new-school technology, these insulated, waterproof boots delivers versatile performance on the local trails.
feature_bullets: The North Face Back To Berkeley Redux
Durable TNF Winter Grip Rubber Outsole Unit
